title: cryptonestuk
author: cryptonestuk
content: Hi all, We're long overdue introducing ourselves on the forum!We're Crypto Nest, an online retailer for all things Cryptocurency hardware here in the UK. We currently stock hardware wallets, seed storage solutions, security keys and more from many different market-leading brands including; Trezor, Coinkite, BitBox, Cryptotag and more.We're working hard to become the one-stop-shop for Cryptocurrency hardware. A place where customers can easily source reliable, authentic products from all the best brands in the industry. With exceptional customer service, cheap and speedy delivery times and a range of resources to help on-board new users to the world of Self-custody. We're keen to get some feedback from you guys, what do you think of our current product range? what products/brands would you like to see us stock? and most importantly, what can we do to help make self-custody more acessible for newbies? Take a look at the store here: https://cryptonest.co.ukAny thoughts are welcome

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: cryptonestuk on March 10, 2023, 05:27:53 PMWe're keen to get some feedback from you guys, what do you think of our current product range? what products/brands would you like to see us stock? and most importantly, what can we do to help make self-custody more acessible for newbies? Welcome!I am not a fan of ledger hardware wallet at all, but you could add their products on your website since they are (sadly) one of the most popular hardware wallets in the world.If you want to add more expensive quality device than I would suggest adding Passport wallet by Foundation, and Keystone hardware wallet.There are more devices available but I don't think there are so much demand for them.

We've always thought the Ellipal Titan and Keystone wallets were pretty similar in many ways, just at slightly different price points.We'll look into this though

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: cryptonestuk on March 10, 2023, 06:05:06 PMPassport and Keystone are both pretty awesome wallets but definitely on the pricey end. We've always thought the Ellipal Titan and Keystone wallets were pretty similar in many ways, just at Keystone is not expensive at all, especially Essential version, and they have discounts all the time maybe because they are working on their new gen hardware wallet, that should be released later this year.Big difference and advantage compared with Ellipal is that Keystone has open source code, while Ellipal is a closed source device and they had some embarrassing bugs in past, they are basically more or less like android phones.If I had to choose hardware wallets I would never choose Ellipal, and they are even more expensive than Keystone, Ellipal Titan is Sale $139 and Keystone Essential is $119 (Pro is $169), plus they have from 30% to 40% discount on that.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Personally, I don't see the advantage of someone ordering something through an intermediary, especially not something as sensitive as a hardware wallet. I especially don't see the point of such purchases since Brexit happened, because now there are customs duties and VAT for all those who are inside the EU, which means that I pay more for the same thing than if I ordered it directly from the manufacturer.The only option that I would consider useful would be some kind of anonymous delivery method, that is, that our personal data would not be exposed to hacking. Unfortunately, your privacy policy does not provide anything more or less than that of most companies that manufacture and sell hardware wallets.Quote from: https://cryptonest.co.uk/policies/privacy-policy How do we keep your information safe? We have organizational and technical processes and procedures in place to protect your personal information. However, no electronic transmission over the internet or information storage technology can be guaranteed to be 100% secure, so we cannot promise or guarantee that hackers, cybercriminals, or other unauthorized third parties will not be able to defeat our security and improperly collect, access, steal, or modify your information.

We have organizational and technical processes and procedures in place to protect your personal information. However, no electronic transmission over the internet or information storage technology can be guaranteed to be 100% secure, so we cannot promise or guarantee that hackers, cybercriminals, or other unauthorized third parties will not be able to defeat our security and improperly collect, access, steal, or modify your information. Appreciate the honest feedback!Currently, it works out much cheaper ordering from us rather than going through the manufacturer. We offer free delivery on all UK orders, there are no import fees or additional taxes and you'll get your order much quicker too!We can certainly appreciate that customers may want to maintain their anonymity when ordering from us, at the moment, we don't have any easy solution for this. However, there's no reason why a customer couldn't place an order under a different name or enter the delivery address to a safe storage unit to avoid sharing any sensitive personal info. Perhaps, offering a collection service or delivery to local collection points could be a solution for this? Alternatively, we could permanently delete customer information a short period after they've placed an order.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: cryptonestuk on March 12, 2023, 04:58:53 PMPerhaps, offering a collection service or delivery to local collection points could be a solution for this? Alternatively, we could permanently delete customer information a short period after they've placed an order.If the user has easy access to a local delivery point, that might be an option. Regarding personal information deletion, how would we verify that our info is deleted, and not stored in another storage for example? How would you process if a customer has an issue with their order too? Deleting after 7 days or a month can be a good idea, but again we won't be able to verify it. Even if we use an anonymous PO BOX to receive the order, you or somebody still has the records.While trust is unavoidable if someone needs to use your service, perhaps you can think to solve this issue. If there is no reliable method to verify, personally I would not use your service even if I have to pay more to buy directly from Ledger/Trezor, etc. Adding another data point that can be exploited by malicious parties is a terrible privacy practice imo.

But now the question arises, why should a user X come to you to buy when he can do it directly from the manufacturer's website? many people including me think it's safer to buy directly from the manufacturer but it would still be interesting to know your opinion on the matter, thanks

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: cryptonestuk on March 12, 2023, 04:58:53 PMAppreciate the honest feedback!Currently, it works out much cheaper ordering from us rather than going through the manufacturer. We offer free delivery on all UK orders, there are no import fees or additional taxes and you'll get your order much quicker too!~snip~I'm just speaking from my perspective of someone for whom it is certainly much faster, simpler and cheaper to order such a device directly from the manufacturer - or even go to a physical store and pay with cash. Your service definitely makes sense for the domestic market, but I don't see how foreign customers would benefit from buying from you, if it means more expensive shipping costs, possible customs costs and additional VAT. Again, on the other hand, I may be too focused on manufacturers from the EU, and if we were to compare the devices that are manufactured and delivered from the US, maybe it would be cheaper or at least faster for those in the EU to order such a device from you. Perhaps you could show with a few examples how much these costs differ, of course if it works in your favor.

If we were to automatically delete personal information (or atleast blank certain details; name, address etc.) after a month of an order being placed, then a simple data request from the customer would verify this. But now the question arises, why should a user X come to you to buy when he can do it directly from the manufacturer's website? many people including me think it's safer to buy directly from the manufacturer but it would still be interesting to know your opinion on the matter, thanksThanks for the feedback  Yes, we certainly have a long way to go in terms of adding all the products/brands we want to work with. We plan to add all of the products you mentioned and more in the coming months.Personally, I think there are some misconceptions when it comes to where to buy hardware wallets and other Crypto related products from. It's well-understood that buying used (or new, but opened) hardware wallets is a BIG no. Buying a product such as this comes with all manor of risks, unfortunately, it it only those who are new to the space that would be susceptible here. Buying from an official reseller (like ourselves), these are usually country specific organisations that aim to bridge current gaps in accessing products at affordable prices in their country. Resellers work closely with manufacturers, allowing them to supply genuine products directly from the manufacturer without long delivery times/additional taxes. All of the products we sell are brand new, un-opened and remain in their sealed packaging just as they left the factory. Buying directly from the manufacturer, whilst deemed to be the most secure, manufacturers often rely on fulfillment services to complete the delivery of items, these fulfillment companies may be working exclusively with the manufacturer or they may work with multiple brands in different industries. Either way this introduces new risks into the supply chain.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: I see no reason to buy from you if everything can be bought directly from official sellers in the same way. Why do it? Try to convince me to buy from you, and not from the official seller, as if I were your potential buyer.It makes sense to use such a store if it is a local store where you can buy immediately on the spot without waiting for delivery.You can add more assortment to the accessories list. For example, fireproof packages, like this - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0924RRC7Z?th=1 or protective metal capsules for storing hardware wallets. These are not as scrupulous and sensitive to security devices as HW devices and the presence of an intermediary can be neglected.

They want the product at the lowest price2. They want a convenient solution to buying the product3. Am I correct in assuming that the above parts mean customers can ask for a refund for opened packages, as long as they didn't use their devices?- If the answer to that is "YES", then what happens to those devices when you get them [the same question goes for "defective or damaged products"]?

We have a 30-day return policy in place whereby customers can return items for a full refund.The only clause is that the item must not be used or taken out of its sealed outer packaging. As long as the item is still in it's sealed packaging when it's returned to us and there are no signs of tampering then the product will be taken back into stock.For cases of defective or damaged products we still offer the refund under the condition that the fault is readily apparent when we receive the item back.

comments.body: Quote from: cryptonestuk on March 13, 2023, 02:43:11 PMQuote from: Lillominato89 on March 13, 2023, 02:28:20 PMQuote from: cryptonestuk on March 13, 2023, 01:24:09 PMQuote from: Lillominato89 on March 13, 2023, 12:47:48 PMQuote from: cryptonestuk on March 13, 2023, 11:26:17 AMQuote from: Lillominato89 on March 13, 2023, 08:26:17 AMQuote from: cryptonestuk on March 10, 2023, 05:27:53 PM We're keen to get some feedback from you guys, what do you think of our current product range? what products/brands would you like to see us stock? and most importantly, what can we do to help make self-custody more acessible for newbies? Take a look at the store here: https://cryptonest.co.ukAny thoughts are welcome Hi, I took a look at your site and I must say that it is well done, but there are a lot of devices missing, such as ledgers, onekeys, keepkeys, etc., to have a wide range of possible buyers, I think you should include them in your catalogue. But now the question arises, why should a user X come to you to buy when he can do it directly from the manufacturer's website? many people including me think it's safer to buy directly from the manufacturer but it would still be interesting to know your opinion on the matter, thanksThanks for the feedback  Yes, we certainly have a long way to go in terms of adding all the products/brands we want to work with. We plan to add all of the products you mentioned and more in the coming months.Personally, I think there are some misconceptions when it comes to where to buy hardware wallets and other Crypto related products from. It's well-understood that buying used (or new, but opened) hardware wallets is a BIG no. Buying a product such as this comes with all manor of risks, unfortunately, it it only those who are new to the space that would be susceptible here. Buying from an official reseller (like ourselves), these are usually country specific organisations that aim to bridge current gaps in accessing products at affordable prices in their country. Resellers work closely with manufacturers, allowing them to supply genuine products directly from the manufacturer without long delivery times/additional taxes. All of the products we sell are brand new, un-opened and remain in their sealed packaging just as they left the factory. Buying directly from the manufacturer, whilst deemed to be the most secure, manufacturers often rely on fulfillment services to complete the delivery of items, these fulfillment companies may be working exclusively with the manufacturer or they may work with multiple brands in different industries. Either way this introduces new risks into the supply chain. Thank you so much for the reply, and also thank you for explaining to me what happens behind the scenes of an import&export company, not being a trader, I don't know the dynamics that lie behind the work of companies like yours, so now whoever reads this thread will know ! I also ask, do you work only for the United Kingdom or do you also ship abroad and to Europe?No problem at all! We're based in the UK, so that is our key demographic. However, we ship orders globally to over 200+ countries with fully tracked/insured delivery through Royal Mail.ok perfect, so if one day I want to buy a hardware wallet from you, I know that you also ship abroad with tracking and insurance! this is a point in your favor I would say. instead on the prices of the various devices do you align yourself with the prices of the official manufacturer? Thank youSure, we try to closely match the Recommended Retail Price set by the manufacturer. In many cases, our products will be priced below the manufacturer, however, in the case of the Titan Mini we also price in the shipping costs (Ellipal is based in Hong Kong) so it's worth bearing this in mind. As for the current discount on the Ellipal website, this would be exclusively for them - we aren't able to match this. obviously a promotion made by the manufacturer and only for their shop is difficult to match, but I sincerely thought it was a promotion also extended to official resellers, in any case I thank you for the explanations you have given me, I hope they have been of some use to everyone , and I wish you much luck with your shop.
